alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Curry County Coast; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 28 at 4:25PM PST until March 01 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 1000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Snow above 1000 feet. Additional snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. Accumulations will be highest in the higher terrain of Curry and Josephine counties, including the Kalmiopsis Wilderness. Most of the area will receive up to an inch of new snow tonight. * WHERE...Curry County Coast, Central Douglas County, Eastern Curry County and Josephine County, Eastern Douglas County Foothills and Jackson County. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; Curry County Coast; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County
